title: Regression bug with `nvim_buf_set_lines` on Neovim nightly

labels.name: bug-regression
labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)

labels.name: has:bisected
labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit

body:
### Problem

When using Neovim nightly there is a bug with `nvim_buf_set_lines` when the buffer is not the active one. After calling this function, the buffer is scrolled to top, not preserving the current cursor position. When I switch to the buffer with changed lines, the cursor position is restored and the window is scrolled correctly. It works as expected in Neovim 0.9.5.

Nightly:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/3128467/b4b0b65a-50cd-413e-8663-53638c721679

0.9.5:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/3128467/b73476c4-a3d7-4a3b-85db-636823847553

### Steps to reproduce

```lua
local lines = {}
for i = 1, 100 do
  lines[i] = tostring(i)
end

vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(OTHER_BUFFER_ID, 0, -1, false, lines)
```

1. Run Neovim nightly
2. Run the provided script for your buffer (use `:luafile` for example)
3. Set your cursor position somewhere in the middle of the file.
4. Create a split and run the provided script for the previously configured buffer (make sure to set the correct buffer id, it can't be 0).

Result: the buffer is scrolled to top.

### Expected behavior

The updated buffer should preserve it's cursor position without scrolling to top.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev-2501+gdbf6be296

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

-

### Operating system/version

macOS 14.2.1

### Terminal name/version

iTerm2

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

repo
